title: Augusta County: John Scott to Samuel Hunt, January 2, 1866
summary: Scott provides a summary report concerning the teachers in Staunton. He talks about their qualifications and what they have been able to accomplish in Staunton. He attacks C. E. Dewey for being too abrasive with local whites. He states that Dewey told one Southerner, "You are worms under our feet."
keywords: African Americans, Education, American Civil War
